5009212/4998354/5105262.title: Scéal
5009212/4998354/5105262.text:
Every night a light used to rise in a field in Strokestown (beside Moredarragh). There were trees growing there, and the light used to rise over them. Then it used to go back slowly and disappear into (Matty MacCormack's fort in Moredarragh.



A man was leading a horse by a well at Kilshrewley. The horse jumped into the well and disappeared. Anyone that ever went to the well, after that with a bucket or gallon, it would be taken out of their hands.

5009212/4998354/5105264.title: Scéal
5009212/4998354/5105264.text:
Every night a light used to rise in a field in Strokestown (beside Moredarragh). There were trees growing there, and the light used to rise over them. Then it used to go back slowly and disappear into (Matty MacCormack's fort in Moredarragh.



A man was leading a horse by a well at Kilshrewley. The horse jumped into the well and disappeared. Anyone that ever went to the well, after that with a bucket or gallon, it would be taken out of their hands.

5009212/4998358/5105281.title: Scéal
5009212/4998358/5105281.text:
In old times the people said there used to be a white horse in Sammon's Lough and that he used to often be out on the shore feeding. One day a cow came out of the lough  and the Sammons brought her up to the house, but the lough rise after her and nearly ran in on Sammons' door, so they had to let go the cow. As soon as they did the lough went back again.



There was once a woman who had a child. The fairies took the child and left another instead of it, but the woman
(continues on next page)

5009212/4998361/5105290.title: Scéal
5009212/4998361/5105290.text:
One time a man was ploughing in a field. When he was ploughing the third scrape, the horses stood. The man shouted at them to go on, but he couldn't get them to move. Then he looked and saw a big stone. He moved the stone away and when he looked down he saw half a hames of gold. He brought it home with him and  got a lot of money for it.



One time there were two men living together,. There name was Sammons and they were very odd. There was a lough near their
(continues on next page)

5009196/4996732/5105663.title: (no title)
5009196/4996732/5105663.text: In the Annar of Galladu in Co. Leitrim there is a lake called Gulladu. In the year 1900 a huge big horse arose almost at the edge of the lake. He was about six feet in length and he had a very big head. He (loved) had long hair growing down his back.    All the neighbours gathered out to see him. He was fiered at with stones and hit many times but never stired.      He was seen by Pat Gill (40) who told Patrick McCabe, Aughagreagh,Parish:- Columbcille,Barony:- Granard, Co. Longford26th March 1936

5177653/5177255/5190807.title: (no title)
5177653/5177255/5190807.text:
251Long ago there was a man and he had seven horses. Every day his seven sons used to go hunting on the Broadford Mountains.One morning that the boys got up they saw a fine young horse abroad in the field.Then the seven boys caught the horse and trained him.In about six months afterwards one of the seven boys was riding the stray horse near Rathlube Lake,and  suddenly a horse got up out of the water and threw the man and horse into the lake and ever since the the marks of the horse's hoofs are to be seen on a certain rock near the lake.



Long ago there was a cruel steward in Ralahine and he would not let the people take any water from the pump
(continues on next page)

5170140/5169099/5196153.title: Strange Animals
5170140/5169099/5196153.text:
There are no strange animals in this part of the country. But sometimes when people are out late at night they meet ghosts. Here is a story I heard about a person who met a ghost at night and he was terrified at the shock.One very dark night he was whistling a tune to himself going past a wood. Suddenly a terrific sweat came over him and he couldn't move a step. Then he saw a ghostly figure riding a horse sitting straight in his saddle riding past him. the horse was very heavy footed and well caparisoned. They rode past him and they came to a well. The house stopped to take a drink and when he did so the pedestrian saw two big red eyes like big balls of fire in the horse. Then all disappeared again and there was a terrific
(continues on next page)

5215809/5214058/5221677.title: A Water Horse
5215809/5214058/5221677.text:
There was a man and he lived in Ballinlough. One night he lost his mare. There was going to be a fair the next day in Westport and he wanted the mare. He could not get the mare so he said he would walk. Next morning he got up at four o'clock. There was a lot of other men going too, but they had their horses with then. Before he went he looked down at the lake and he saw a white horse the colour of his own horse grazing along the side of the lake. He went down to her and jumped up. The minute he was above the horse galloped out into the lake. In two minutes
(continues on next page)

5235084/5233732/5235218.title: Fairies
5235084/5233732/5235218.text:
(continued from previous page)
passing by.Also that that same night that the fairies came for his child two children were dead in the same street next morning.



The Banshee still comes to warn the people that death is near.She is often reported heard round here, especially before old  natives die.



Mrs Oates says she saw a water horse in Lough [?] that it came up and ploughed round the fields and that a man followed it with a whip and that it kicked the man to death.



Once a girl who lived near a lake down below Carrick disappeared when she was washing her clothes on its brink. She used to wash there always but  one day she never returned and no trace of her could be found so it is
(continues on next page)

5236078/5218077/5240426.title: Water Horses
5236078/5218077/5240426.text: There was once a man living in village name Gorrow, a little village in the parish of Aughagower. One day he left his mare grazing by the side of a lake until it was dusk. When he went out for his mare he came up to a water horse and thinking it was his own mare he put on the halter and went riding. The horse galloped to the lake and the man had just jumped off the horse when the horse dived into the lake again

5236078/5218227/5240708.title: Water Horses
5236078/5218227/5240708.text:
There are water horses in a lake called Ail More. There was once a man coming from town with an ass. He saw a horse coming towards him from the lake. The horse jumped out of the lake and pulled the man down under the water. A few hours after his body was floating on top of the water.



A woman was churning and a tinker came in. It is usually for people to churn when they come to a house where the churning is in progress. The tinker went out again and did not
(continues on next page)

5236078/5218262/5240772.title: Water Dog
5236078/5218262/5240772.text:
(continued from previous page)
ran acrosss when the water dashed after him and the water dog got killed. The man was afraid to go near the place where he killed the water dog



There is a water horse in Ballinlough lake. One night he left the lake and came up to a mans door and the people of the house heard him neighing and at last he went away and the people of the house were afraid to go near the lake at night.



There is an old saying that if a person ties a roundberry tree round the churn he will have luck in butter for all the year. On May day if a person brings a blade of thatch out of the house he will bring the luck of the butter for the
(continues on next page)

5236078/5218345/5240929.title: Water Horses
5236078/5218345/5240929.text: One time a man was cleaning a drain He had finished his evenings work and when he came to the drain the next morning he got a dead water horse in the drainOne time a man was ploughing and he let his horse out to graze for a while during the dinner hour. When he went for his horse again he saw a horse by the lake which he thought was his own horse. He put the head collar on him and he went on his back. As soon as he went on his back the horse sprang right into the lake and the man was almost drowned and the next morning he died.

5236078/5218377/5240963.title: A Water Horse
5236078/5218377/5240963.text: Once up on a time a man named Pat Malley of Ballagorman saw a water horse. He went near him and he jumped in to Ballin-lough lake. Another man got a water horse and he put shoes on him and he ploughed and harrowed him. One day he went to the river to give him a drink and when he brought him to the river he jumped in to the river and he never saw him again.

5236078/5218435/5241086.title: Fairy Forts
5236078/5218435/5241086.text:
(continued from previous page)
[?]



Once upon a time a man who lived near Ballin Lough lake went out to catch his horse in the field at night. He saw a horse which looked like his own horse and went up to catch him. He put the bridle on him and he went on his back. The horse began running as far as the lake in order to throw his rider into the lake but the man jumped off the horse and the water horse went into the lake.

5215809/5231355/5264025.title: A Water Horse
5215809/5231355/5264025.text:
There was a water-horse seen often at Lisearney Lake. Once upon a time Mrs Morrison saw a water-horse coming swimming in the lake. Her house is not far from the lake and she could hear the noise coming through the water. She said it seemed to be swimming on its side like an ordinary horse. When it came to the brink it ran about and then went into a greenfield and ate there for half an hour. After a while it went in again. Many people after saw a crowd of water-horses grazing in the fields above the bank.
(continues on next page)

5215809/5231451/5265032.title: A Water Horse
5215809/5231451/5265032.text: Some years ago a water horse was seen at Liscarney lake By Edward Scahill. He went near the horse to see him and he followed him a bit and then returned back again. He said the water horse was about the size of a horse-foal and that he was grey in colour.  He remarked also that he had a very long tail and it was brushing against the ground. When he came to the brink of the lake he galloped about the brink and then suddenly went into the water and disappeared.  A horse was seen lately swimming in Liscarney lake.

5215809/5231452/5265034.title: A Water Horse
5215809/5231452/5265034.text:
Some years ago Pat Walsh of Leitreen had no horse for ploughing. One day he saw a water horse at Leitreen lake. He went down to him and put the bridle on him and rode him up to his own house. Then he started ploughing. The water- h did a great bit of work for him. So when the dark came he put him into his barn. The water was very quiet but he was awful for biting. Pat Walsh himself said that he was bay in colour and he said the size of him was about the size of a horse-foal.The next day early in the morning he went down to the lake with him for a drink. When the water horse came in sight of the lake he got into a gallop with Pat Walsh on him. When Pat Walsh saw that
(continues on next page)

5215809/5231454/5265040.title: A Water Horse
5215809/5231454/5265040.text:
Some years ago two young lads went fishing to a lake in Drummin called Loch na Quilligan. This lake is between two hills. They had a board for fishing with them and a fishing rod. When they had the board just left down in the lake they saw an animal coming towards them furiously in the lake. They said it had a very big mane and a very big head and they could hear it snuffing in the water. The animal was coming near the brink of the lake and they were getting afraid as they had no weapons with them so they took for the hills as quickly as they could They said it was like a water  horse. They never went fishing to that lake againSome years ago also
(continues on next page)

5215809/5231502/5265174.title: A Water Horse
5215809/5231502/5265174.text: There was once a man out visiting out late one moonlight night. When he came in from visiting he went out looking for his mare. He saw a mare very like his own mare near a lake. He went up and caught her by the mane and he jumped upon her back. The mare walked down to the lake and sprang into the water and drowned the man.John ReidKnappabeg, Westport.

5215809/5231504/5265176.title: A Water Horse
5215809/5231504/5265176.text: Once upon at time there was a man out late at night and when he came home he went looking for his mare. He saw a mare in a field the same colour as his own mare. He jumped up on her back and she trotted down to Ballinglough lake and she sprang into the water. He jumped off her back in the water and he escaped.

5215809/5231531/5265205.title: A Water Horse
5215809/5231531/5265205.text: A man in Ballinlough named John Kane saw a water horse several times but he failed to catch her. One day he said that he would catch her. When the water horse came in on land the man stole up and caught her and brought her at once to the forge and put shoes on her. He then went home and next day brought the horse back to the field and worked her for the whole day. The horse was very quiet and a good worker. This continued for four or five years. One day the horse lost her shoes and off she went as fast as she could for the lake and she was never heard of again.

5215809/5231646/5265496.title: A Water Horse
5215809/5231646/5265496.text:
There is supposed to be a water-horse in Ballinlough lake long ago. They are supposed to be of different colours some black and white and others red and white. They are supposed to come up every evening eating grass by the side of the lake. Sometimes also they swim up the river.One evening when a man who was living near the lake came for his cows he saw a strange black and white pony grazing with the cows. It was a water horse but the man thought it was a stray horse.The man went up to him and went riding on him. He tried to drive him out on the road but he turned round and sprang into the water. When he got into the water
(continues on next page)

5215809/5231685/5265604.title: A Water Horse
5215809/5231685/5265604.text: One morning long ago when a man from Ballinlough got up he saw a water horse in a field and he went up to the horse and caught him he did not stir until the man was riding on him and as soon as the man went riding on the horse he ran as quickly as he could and he jumped into the lake with the man riding on him and the man was never heard of from that day to this.

5215809/5231762/5265834.title: Water Horse and the Man
5215809/5231762/5265834.text:
Water horse and the manLong long ago there was a man living in Gleann na Glimack and his name was Martin Brown and he was to go to a fair.  In the evening he was talking to one of his neighbours and he told him that he would be with him in the morning and he said not to go to the fair with out him and the man said no.  He said to the neighbour he had no more time to delay because he had to go to look after his horse and the neighbour went home and Martin went looking for his horse and he could not get him.  He saw a lake and off Martin went to it.  When he was near the lake he saw a horse the very same
(continues on next page)
